name: Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados Pessoais (LGPD)
description: Brazilian General Data Protection Law regulating the processing of personal data in Brazil

regulatoryAuthority.name: Autoridade Nacional de Proteção de Dados (ANPD)

keyArticles.Article 7: Legal bases for processing personal data
keyArticles.Article 9: Right to information about processing (transparency requirements)
keyArticles.Article 14: Processing of children and adolescents' data

principles: Purpose - specific, explicit, and legitimate purposes
Free access - guarantee to data subjects
legalBases: Compliance with legal or regulatory obligation
Protection of life or physical safety
Legitimate interests of controller or third party
requirements: Contact details of the data protection officer (Article 41)
Type and duration of the processing
Information regarding shared use of data
Transparent, clear, and unambiguous information when consent required
Right to confirmation of processing existence
Right to correction of inaccurate, incomplete, or outdated data
Right to anonymization, blocking, or deletion of unnecessary or excessive data
Right to data portability to another service provider
Right to deletion of data processed with consent
Right to information about public and private entities with which data was shared
Right to information about possibility of not providing consent and consequences
Children and adolescents' data protection (under 18 - Article 14)
Procedures for exercising data subject rights
National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) contact information
dataSubjectRights: Correction of incomplete, inaccurate, or outdated data
Anonymization, blocking, or deletion of unnecessary/excessive data
Data portability to another service provider
Deletion of data processed with consent (upon request)
Information about data sharing with public and private entities
Information about possibility and consequences of not providing consent
mandatoryElements: Complete list of data subject rights (Article 18)
Information presented in transparent, clear, and unambiguous manner
sensitivePersonalData: Trade union or religious, philosophical, or political organization membership

specialConsiderations.children: Processing of children and adolescents' data (under 18) requires consent from at least one parent or legal guardian (Article 14)
specialConsiderations.sensitiveData: Sensitive personal data requires specific consent and heightened protection (Article 11)
specialConsiderations.internationalTransfer: International transfers require adequacy decision, standard contractual clauses, or specific authorization (Articles 33-36)
specialConsiderations.dataProtectionOfficer: DPO designation is mandatory for processing of significant volume of data (Article 41)
specialConsiderations.breaches: Data breach notification required to ANPD and affected data subjects (Article 48)
specialConsiderations.penalties: Administrative sanctions up to 2% of revenue (max R$50 million per infraction) - Article 52
specialConsiderations.enforcement: ANPD has authority to investigate, sanction, and enforce LGPD compliance

consentRequirements.form: Consent must be provided in writing or by other means demonstrating data subject's intent
consentRequirements.clarity: Must be presented in a clear and unambiguous manner
consentRequirements.separation: Consent clauses must be highlighted and separate from other contractual clauses
consentRequirements.granularity: Consent for different purposes must be collected separately
consentRequirements.children: For children under 18, consent from parent or legal guardian required
consentRequirements.revocation: Data subjects may revoke consent at any time

dataProtectionOfficer.designation: Must be designated when processing significant volumes of data (Article 41)
responsibilities: Accept complaints and communications from data subjects
Receive communications from ANPD and adopt measures
dataProtectionOfficer.disclosure: Identity and contact information must be publicly and clearly disclosed
